answers.answer: Hello,The "period" you had was a withdrawal bleed from the pill (it would have been a progesterone pill) your doctor gave you.  Metformin is commonly used in women with PCOS as it has been shown to facilitate weight loss and increase the likelihood of ovulation.  Gastro-intestinal side effect (diarrhea and gas) are common side effects of this medication.I'd encourage you to continue to follow up with your doc.  If a woman with PCOS is not able to ovulate with weight loss and Metformin in order to conceive, Clomid (with or without Metformin) can be used to induce ovulation.Again, I'd encourage you to follow up with your doctor regarding these matters.Best regards,Dr. Downing

title: Why do i feel like this?
